content.question: The left figure shows a small positively charged sphere and point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, located on the vertices of a triangle. In the right figure, a small negatively charged sphere is added at the third vertex. The charge on this sphere has the same magnitude as the positive charge on the other sphere. Which of the following correctly shows the direction of the electric field at <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the two situations?

choices.label: The figure presents an arrow labeled One Sphere, which is pointing upwards and to the right, and another arrow labeled Two Spheres, which is pointing horizontally to the right.

The figure presents an arrow labeled One Sphere, which is pointing upwards and to the right, and another arrow labeled Two Spheres, which is pointing upwards and farther to the right than the first arrow.
The figure presents an arrow labeled One Sphere, which is pointing downwards and to the left, and another arrow labeled Two Spheres, which is pointing horizontally to the left.

The figure presents an arrow labeled One Sphere, which is pointing downwards and to the left, and another arrow labeled Two Spheres, which is pointing downwards and farther to the left than the first arrow.

content.answer: The figure presents an arrow labeled One Sphere, which is pointing upwards and to the right, and another arrow labeled Two Spheres, which is pointing horizontally to the right.
